p:
The mechanism of cTn elevation in COVID-19 infection is not fully understood. Elevations are likely to reflect non-coronary disease rather than acute coronary disease such as myocardial infarction.
19 The underlying pathophysiology is suggestive of a cardio-inflammatory response, as many critically ill COVID-19 patients demonstrate concomitant elevations in acute phase reactants such as CRP and the natriuretic peptides. This may present clinically as fulminant myocarditis.
